Mother Orange Tree.knownFor: “ Interesting piece of agricultural history ” Reviewed February 28, 2015 The "Mother Orange Tree" is the oldest living orange tree in California, having been planted in 1856. Cuttings were used from the tree to start the california orange tree industry in Northern California. The tree sits alone barracaded from the public by a cast iron fence. However, the tree still bears fruit and low-hanging ones can be reached and tasted!... More Helpful? 2 Thank Rogerdob Report
reviewComments: Without a doubt, the largest orange tree I have ever seen AND it has fruit on it! Tucked away and somewhat tricky to find, this is where the California orange tradition began.
This site is an excellent learning experience about Chinese culture in North-eastern California. Beautiful artifacts, amazing architecture, and important history.
This temple was built for the large Chinese population in Oroville during the 1860s with funds that came directly from the Emperor of China. The temple is now owned by the city... read more
The temple is full of exhibits including clothing and artifacts of the beginning of Chinese settlement in the area.
